intro: Capraria aegyptiaca, commonly known as Egyptian caper. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, and it is native to regions of North Africa and the Middle East. Capraria aegyptiaca is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are typically small, opposite, and have a slightly hairy texture.
